errors.title: TTS MEDIA: parser rejects absolute paths
errors.description: OpenClaw's isValidMedia() in /opt/homebrew/lib/node_modules/openclaw/dist/media/parse.js only accepts ./relative paths and https:// URLs. TTS tool generates files at absolute paths like /var/folders/1k/.../voice-*.opus, which get rejected â€” MEDIA: line passes through as plain text instead of being parsed as media.
errors.workaround: Use `message` tool with `filePath` + `asVoice: true` instead of inline MEDIA: directive. Bypasses the media parser entirely.
errors.solution: Patched parse.js locally to accept absolute paths. Patch applied on 2026-02-01.
errors.prevention: Patch will be overwritten on `openclaw update`. Should file upstream bug. After any update, verify TTS still works or re-apply patch.

errors.title: X/Twitter fetches blocked by bot detection
errors.description: web_fetch on x.com URLs returns 'Something went wrong' due to privacy/bot detection. nitter.net returns empty content. Cannot read tweet content programmatically.
errors.workaround: Ask Marcel to paste tweet content, or use browser tool to load the page.
